subject: Re: [junit] textui vs swingui
msgSnippet: ... Ralf  Ok, just looking at the source gave me this idea: Ralf public static void main(String args[]) { Ralf 	// Ralf 	//
messageBody:
>>>>> "Ralf" == Ralf Krakowski <ralf.krakowski@...> writes:

Ralf> Ok, just looking at the source gave me this idea:
Ralf> public static void main(String args[]) {
Ralf> //
Ralf> // junit.textui.TestRunner.run(FooStatelessTest.class);
Ralf> // junit.swingui.TestRunner.run(FooStatelessTest.class);
Ralf> String apa [] = {"-noloading",
Ralf> FooStatelessTest.class.getName()};
Ralf> junit.swingui.TestRunner.main(apa);

Ralf> That did it, but i don't know if it's "nice"..

Like I said, Ralf, you can get a better solution by using
excluded.properties. Check out the archive for messages about
this. What you did will work, you just have to restart junt each time,
which is kind of a pain.

bab
